Company: The Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance Co.
Description: The Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance Co. agreed to pay a $150,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations its previous use of the automatic default option establishing a retained asset account could result in an unsuitable arrangement for a beneficiary, in violation of state regulations.

The Department of Financial Services entered into consent orders with six life insurance companies to resolve alleged violations of New York Insurance Regulations in deferred to immediate annuity replacement transactions.  The insurers, collectively, agreed  to pay $1,152,154 in restitution and $673,000 in penalties.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: $50,000 fine levied for failing to keep full and adequate records, the Company violated RCW 48.05.280 and for failing to pay the correct amount of interest on death benefits in 1,586 instances. Company ordered to issue remediation payments within 30 days of the entry of the consent order to beneficiaries and to provide proof of payments within 30 days of completion of remediation payments.
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Northwestern agreed to pay a $287,000 administrative penalty to settle allegations it had failed to pay required interest on life insurance policy claims in at least 306 instances since 2006.

The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority entered into final settlements with three additional firms to settle charges relating to the sale of auction rate securities (ARS) that became illiquid when auctions froze in February 2008.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.

Description: NASD fined Northwestern Mutual Investment Services, LLC, of Milwaukee, WI, $100,000 for failure to have adequate supervisory systems and procedures to ensure that clients received Net Asset Value (NAV) pricing when appropriate under NAV transfer programs.
Info Source: NASD Settles Cases Against MML Investors Services, NYLIFE Securities, Securities America and Northwestern Mutual Investment Services for Fines Totaling over $1.2 Million for Failures Relating to Mutual Fund Sales, States News Service, June 28, 2007 (via Nexis).
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).
